---
title: Git Clone Demo
---

# Git Clone

This runbook demonstrates the GitClone block, which provides a streamlined way to clone git repositories with optional GitHub integration.

## Step 1: Authenticate to GitHub

Authenticate to GitHub to enable the repository browser and private repo access.

<GitHubAuth
  id="gh-auth"
  title="Connect to GitHub"
  description="Authenticate to access private repositories and enable the GitHub browser"
/>

## Step 2: Clone a GitHub Repository

Clone any repository. If you authenticated above, you'll see a "Browse GitHub repositories" option to discover repos by org/name. You can also just paste any git URL.

<GitClone
  id="clone-github"
  gitHubAuthId="gh-auth"
  title="Clone a GitHub Repo"
  description="Enter a git URL or browse GitHub to select a repository"
/>

## Step 3: Clone a Subdirectory (pre-filled URL)

This example pre-fills the URL and clones only the `docs` subdirectory using sparse checkout.

<GitClone
  id="clone-subdir"
  gitHubAuthId="gh-auth"
  title="Clone a Subdirectory"
  description="Clone only the docs directory from the runbooks repo"
  prefilledUrl="https://github.com/gruntwork-io/runbooks"
  prefilledRepoPath="docs"
  prefilledLocalPath="./runbooks-docs"
/>

## Step 4: Clone without GitHub (Generic Git)

This example works without any GitHub authentication — just enter a git URL for any public repository.

<GitClone
  id="clone-generic"
  title="Clone Any Git Repo"
  description="Clone a repository using a plain git URL — no GitHub token needed for public repos"
/>
